content:
Please restructure the **IT Inventory** database as described below. Your automation will be checked by an automated script, so follow every detail exactly.

---
Task Steps
1. Inside the **IT Trouble Shooting Hub** page, locate the database named **IT Inventory**.
2. Query this database and collect every page whose **Status** property is **Expired** or **To be returned**.
3. Create a **new full-page database** directly under the same IT Trouble Shooting Hub page called **IT Asset Retirement Queue**.
4. Configure this new database so that it contains **exactly** the following properties (spellings and types must match):
   • Serial – title  
   • Tags – multi_select  
   • Status – select  
   • Vendor – select  
   • Expiration date – date  
   • Retirement Reason – select with option set { **Expired License**, **Hardware Obsolete**, **Security Risk**, **User Offboarding** }
5. For every inventory item gathered in step2:
   a. Create a corresponding page in **IT Asset Retirement Queue** and copy over the values of the Serial, Tags, Status, Vendor and Expiration date properties.  
   b. Set **Retirement Reason** to one of the four options above (choose the most appropriate).  
   c. Archive the original inventory page **after** the new page has been created.
6. After all items are migrated:
   a. Update the **description** of the **IT Asset Retirement Queue** database so it is **exactly** `AUTO-GENERATED MIGRATION COMPLETED` (no additional text).
   b. Create a new page under **IT Trouble Shooting Hub** titled **Retirement Migration Log**. Inside this page, add a **callout block** whose text follows the exact pattern:

      `Successfully migrated <N> assets to the retirement queue on 2025-03-24.`

      • `<N>` is the total number of items moved.

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

content.text: I'll help you restructure the IT Inventory database as described. Let me start by exploring the available Notion actions to understand what's possible.

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"servers\\\":{\\\"Notion\\\":{\\\"detail_level\\\":\\\"categories_only\\\",\\\"details\\\":[\\\"NOTION_USERS\\\",\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\",\\\"NOTION_SEARCH\\\",\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\",\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\",\\\"NOTION_COMMENTS\\\"]}}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me get the actions available for the relevant categories:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"category_actions\\\":{\\\"NOTION_PAGES\\\":[\\\"retrieve_a_page\\\",\\\"patch_page\\\",\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_page_property\\\"],\\\"NOTION_DATABASES\\\":[\\\"post_database_query\\\",\\\"create_a_database\\\",\\\"update_a_database\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_database\\\"],\\\"NOTION_SEARCH\\\":[\\\"post_search\\\"],\\\"NOTION_BLOCKS\\\":[\\\"get_block_children\\\",\\\"patch_block_children\\\",\\\"retrieve_a_block\\\",\\\"update_a_block\\\",\\\"delete_a_block\\\"]}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Perfect! Now let me start by searching for the "IT Trouble Shooting Hub" page to locate the IT Inventory database:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_search\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/search\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Search by title\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"query\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The text that the API compares page and database titles against.\\\"},\\\"sort\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `\\\\\\\"last_edited_time\\\\\\\"`. Supported `direction` values are `\\\\\\\"ascending\\\\\\\"` and `\\\\\\\"descending\\\\\\\"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"direction\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.\\\"},\\\"timestamp\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.\\\"}}},\\\"filter\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `\\\\\\\"page\\\\\\\"` or `\\\\\\\"database\\\\\\\"`. The only supported `property` value is `\\\\\\\"object\\\\\\\"`.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"value\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)\\\"},\\\"property\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)\\\"}}},\\\"start_cursor\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.\\\"},\\\"page_size\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"int32\\\"}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me search for the "IT Trouble Shooting Hub" page:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"server_name\\\":\\\"Notion\\\",\\\"action_name\\\":\\\"post_search\\\",\\\"execution_result\\\":{\\\"success\\\":true,\\\"data\\\":{\\\"results\\\":[{\\\"id\\\":\\\"27460215-0acf-81e7-a605-fb8557d4a452\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"id\\\":\\\"title\\\",\\\"type\\\":\\\"title\\\",\\\"title\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"text\\\",\\\"text\\\":{\\\"content\\\":\\\"It Trouble Shooting Hub\\\",\\\"link\\\":null},\\\"annotations\\\":{\\\"bold\\\":false,\\\"italic\\\":false,\\\"strikethrough\\\":false,\\\"underline\\\":false,\\\"code\\\":false,\\\"color\\\":\\\"default\\\"},\\\"plain_text\\\":\\\"It Trouble Shooting Hub\\\",\\\"href\\\":null}]}}},{\\\"id\\\":\\\"26260215-0acf-80bd-aea7-f5556dab9f21\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"id\\\":\\\"title\\\",\\\"type\\\":\\\"title\\\",\\\"title\\\":[{\\\"type\\\":\\\"text\\\",\\\"text\\\":{\\\"content\\\":\\\"MCPMark Eval Hub\\\",\\\"link\\\":null},\\\"annotations\\\":{\\\"bold\\\":false,\\\"italic\\\":false,\\\"strikethrough\\\":false,\\\"underline\\\":false,\\\"code\\\":false,\\\"color\\\":\\\"default\\\"},\\\"plain_text\\\":\\\"MCPMark Eval Hub\\\",\\\"href\\\":null}]}}}]},\\\"status_code\\\":200}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Great! I found the "It Trouble Shooting Hub" page (ID: 27460215-0acf-81e7-a605-fb8557d4a452). Now let me get the child blocks/pages to find the IT Inventory database:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"get_block_children\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"GET\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/blocks/{block_id}/children\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Retrieve block children\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"block_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"Identifier for a [block](ref:block)\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{\\\"start_cursor\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.\\\"},\\\"page_size\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"int32\\\",\\\"required\\\":false,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100\\\"}},\\\"body_schema\\\":{},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Perfect! I found the IT Inventory database (ID: 27460215-0acf-81f6-85b8-d66145782fa2). It's a child of block ID 27460215-0acf-814d-942a-cfb6eaf13a23. Let me now get the database details to understand its structure:

If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.\\\"},\\\"page_size\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"integer\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100\\\"},\\\"archived\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\"},\\\"in_trash\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\"}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text:
Perfect! I found 2 items to migrate:
1. Serial: "65XYQ/GB" - Status: "Expired", Tags: "License", Vendor: "Pixell", Expiration date: "2023-06-30"
2. Serial: "36x10PIQ" - Status: "To be returned", Tags: "Computer Accessory", Vendor: "Pineapple", Expiration date: "2023-06-22"

Now I need to create the new database "IT Asset Retirement Queue" under the IT Trouble Shooting Hub page. First, let me get the details for creating a database:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"create_a_database\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/databases\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Create a database\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"parent\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"page_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"type\\\",\\\"page_id\\\"]},\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are [property schema objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/property-schema-object).\\\"},\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"text\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"text\\\"]}}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"parent\\\",\\\"properties\\\"]},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me create the new database "IT Asset Retirement Queue":

content.text: Great! The new database has been created with ID: 27460215-0acf-8153-9456-cf7ec44b488e. Now I need to create pages in this database for the two items I found. First, let me get the details for creating a page:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"POST\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/pages\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Create a page\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"parent\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"page_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"page_id\\\"]},\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"title\\\"]},\\\"children\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).\\\",\\\"items\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\"}},\\\"icon\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"json\\\"},\\\"cover\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).\\\",\\\"format\\\":\\\"json\\\"}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"parent\\\",\\\"properties\\\"]},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me create the second page for the computer accessory item:

name: execute_action

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"server_name\\\":\\\"Notion\\\",\\\"action_name\\\":\\\"post_page\\\",\\\"execution_result\\\":{\\\"success\\\":true,\\\"data\\\":{\\\"id\\\":\\\"27460215-0acf-81a5-be2b-d444877cb5dd\\\"},\\\"status_code\\\":200}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Perfect! Both pages have been created. Now I need to archive the original inventory pages. Let me get the details for updating/archiving a page:

output: {"type": "text", "text": "{\"meta\": null, \"content\": [{\"type\": \"text\", \"text\": \"{\\\"name\\\":\\\"patch_page\\\",\\\"method\\\":\\\"PATCH\\\",\\\"path\\\":\\\"/v1/pages/{page_id}\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Update page properties\\\",\\\"tags\\\":[],\\\"path_params\\\":{\\\"page_id\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"format\\\":null,\\\"required\\\":true,\\\"description\\\":\\\"The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.\\\"}},\\\"query_params\\\":{},\\\"body_schema\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"title\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"array\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"title\\\"]},\\\"in_trash\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.\\\"},\\\"archived\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"boolean\\\"},\\\"icon\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"emoji\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"emoji\\\"]},\\\"cover\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"description\\\":\\\"A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.\\\",\\\"properties\\\":{\\\"external\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"object\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true},\\\"type\\\":{\\\"type\\\":\\\"string\\\",\\\"_truncated\\\":true}},\\\"required\\\":[\\\"external\\\"]}}},\\\"response_schema\\\":{}}\", \"annotations\": null, \"meta\": null}], \"structuredContent\": null, \"isError\": false}", "annotations": null, "meta": null}

content.text: Now let me archive the first original inventory page:

content.text:
Perfect! I have successfully completed all the required tasks:

## Task Completed Successfully!

Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

1. ✅ **Located IT Inventory database** - Found within the IT Trouble Shooting Hub page
2. ✅ **Queried and collected expired/to-be-returned items** - Found 2 items:
   - Serial: "65XYQ/GB" (Status: Expired, License, Pixell vendor)
   - Serial: "36x10PIQ" (Status: To be returned, Computer Accessory, Pineapple vendor)
3. ✅ **Created new database "IT Asset Retirement Queue"** - Under IT Trouble Shooting Hub with all required properties:
   - Serial (title)
   - Tags (multi_select)
   - Status (select)
   - Vendor (select)
   - Expiration date (date)
   - Retirement Reason (select with 4 specified options)
4. ✅ **Migrated both inventory items** - Created corresponding pages in the retirement queue with:
   - All original property values copied over
   - Appropriate retirement reasons assigned (Expired License for the license item, User Offboarding for the computer accessory)
   - Original pages archived after successful creation
5. ✅ **Updated database description** - Set to exactly "AUTO-GENERATED MIGRATION COMPLETED"
6. ✅ **Created Retirement Migration Log page** - Under IT Trouble Shooting Hub with a callout block containing the exact text: "Successfully migrated 2 assets to the retirement queue on 2025-03-24."

The automation has been completed according to all specifications, with 2 assets successfully migrated from the IT Inventory to the new IT Asset Retirement Queue database.
